google_reviews.author: Graham Armstrong
google_reviews.review:
We rented from Howard and Caroline for 5 years, and while their management style might not work for everyone, it was perfect for us. We were comfortable handling the majority of maintenance and repairs on our own,  and they were comfortable being "hands-off" landlords. We paid a very reasonable price the entire time that we rented from them.

They are also good people. I will miss having small chats with Caroline once a month while turning in rent.

google_reviews.author: Nick Hatch
google_reviews.review:
I've been a tenant with Adams for over three years, and have been pleased with the no-nonsense approach they take with property management. Problems generally get fixed quickly, and they'll be a respectful and attentive landlord as long as you're an attentive tenant.

They have a reputation for being strict, but I've always been a respectful tenant, and am treated with the same respect.

They've never played games with nickel-and-diming security deposits, something many other landlords in Bellingham seem to love to do.

DO NOT let Howard Adams bully you!

summary.text:
Good

In the "Good" section of this article's analysis of Adams Property Management, some tenants have appreciated their no-nonsense approach to property management. Tenants who prefer a hands-off landlord found Adams to be satisfactory, citing a comfort with handling their own maintenance and repairs, and appreciation for the autonomy that Adams allowed in doing so. Additionally, there’s recognition of their reasonable pricing, hinting that tenants feel they're receiving fair value for their rentals.

Furthermore, positive user reviews reflect a sentiment that problems, when they do occur, tend to be addressed in a timely manner. Tenants expressed contentment with quick fixes to issues and a respectful engagement from the property management as long as the tenants themselves maintained their responsibilities. Such experiences indicate that some tenants have had amicable and professional relationships with Adams Property Management over the years.

Great

The company also seems to excel in certain areas according to user reviews. There are mentions of Adams Property Management's representatives being punctual in dealing with issues, which is a crucial attribute for any tenant dealing with property-related problems. Additionally, for landlords, Adams has been praised for their thoroughness in screening tenants and their overall reliability in property management tasks.

High marks come, too, from those noting that the management company exhibits integrity and honesty, and maintains excellent communication. This is particularly valued by property owners who rely on Adams to manage interactions with tenants and to follow through on both routine and special requests, ensuring that governing tasks do not fall by the wayside.

Bad

However, not all user reviews are favorable. One of the issues mentioned repeatedly is a perceived neglect regarding maintenance concerns. Tenants have reported incidents where they had to take on the responsibility for arranging repairs, which can be a significant inconvenience and not a standard expectation in a tenant-management relationship. Some reviews highlighted difficulties in having carpets and appliances fixed, citing a need to constantly follow up and advocate for these basic maintenance needs.

Moreover, there have been complaints regarding financial dealings with the company. From the perspective of a departing tenant, Adams Property Management is depicted as rigid, potentially retaining last month’s rent despite early vacancy of the premises and threatening legal action without considering the quality or duration of the tenant's residency, which can be viewed as an inflexible and harsh approach to lease agreements.

Ugly

Among the most severe criticisms found in user reviews are allegations of unprofessional conduct by Adams Property Management. Instances of aggressive and disrespectful behavior towards tenants, particularly women, have been cited, undercutting the essential reliance on civility and trust in a landlord-tenant relationship. Tenants have reported extreme encounters involving verbal harassment and unannounced, intrusive visits, which could lead to an uncomfortable and hostile living environment.

The office conditions and organizational skills of the company have been called into question as well, with one long-term tenant describing their rental experience as extremely negative due to the disarray and lack of professionalism encountered. Claims of an untidy office, misplaced paperwork, and delayed responses compound the negative narrative, painting a picture of a property management company that struggles with the fundamentals of business operations and customer service.
